item.title: 英国气象局发布降雨和洪水 "危及生命 "警告
item.description: 气象局发布了黄色天气预警，暴雨和深层洪水可能会造成 "生命危险"。【原文：The Met Office has issued an amber weather warning for heavy rain and deep floodwater that could cause "danger to life".】

item.title: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削减尽职调查指令
item.description: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削弱其最具影响力的环境、社会和治理法规之一。【原文：The European Commission is proposing a significant watering down of what had been one of its most consequential pieces of ESG regulation.】

item.title: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）称，特朗普要求联邦科学家结束气候报告工作
item.description: 一位参与编写全球气候报告的科学家告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNN），特朗普政府让美国政府科学家停止他们的工作。【原文：The Trump administration told US government scientists working on a global climate report to stop their work, one of the scientists involved told CNN.】

item.title: 大雪让美国东海岸滑雪胜地超越西部竞争对手
item.description:
强劲的暴风雪正在新英格兰部分地区倾泻数十英尺厚的积雪。滑雪者们正尽情享受着这难得的雪景。【原文：

Powerful storms are dumping dozens of feet of snow across parts of New England. Skiers are reveling in it while it lasts. 

】

item.title: 华尔街出走后，气候组织考虑取消 1.5C 目标
item.description:
在一波高调退出之后，零净值银行联盟（Net-Zero Banking Alliance）正在考虑对其成员条款进行全面修订。【原文：

The Net-Zero Banking Alliance is considering an overhaul of its membership terms after a wave of high-profile exits.

】

item.title: 英国拒绝确认未来基金，GB 能源面临新疑虑
item.description: 英国财政部正在考虑在其将于 6 月公布的多年支出计划中纳入哪些内容，因此，为英国新兴国有企业 GB 能源公司提供 83 亿英镑（105 亿美元）资金的一揽子承诺受到质疑。【原文：A promised £8.3 billion ($10.5 billion) funding package for the UK’s nascent state-owned company GB Energy is under question as the Treasury considers what to include in its multi year spending plan due in June.】

item.title: 无用的高压电线可能引发加州大火
item.description:
一条闲置了几十年的生产线被指控引发了洛杉矶地区致命的伊顿大火。【原文：

A line idle for decades has been accused of starting the LA area’s deadly Eaton Fire.

】

item.title: 南非港口城市德班配给水以抑制需求
item.description: 由于供不应求，南非东部港口城市德班将加强供水配给，给供水系统造成压力。【原文：South Africa’s eastern port city of Durban will intensify water rationing as demand outstrips supply, placing strain on the system.】

item.title: 英国放宽海上风电规定以推动可再生能源发展
item.description: 英国政府公布了加快海上风电等可再生能源项目推广的改革措施，以实现到 2030 年建成清洁电力系统的目标。【原文：The UK government unveiled reforms to speed up the rollout of renewable energy projects such as offshore wind as it targets a clean power system by 2030.】

item.title: StanChart 称 2025 年清洁能源目标难以实现
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）表示，该公司可能无法实现 2025 年只使用可再生能源满足其电力需求的目标，理由是在其开展业务的一些市场中缺乏选择。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc said it may not meet its 2025 target of using only renewable energy for its power needs, citing a lack of options in some of the markets in which it operates.】

item.title: 韩国在弹劾亲核领导人后取消反应堆计划
item.description: 原子能倡导者尹锡烈总统被弹劾后，反对党对韩国的长期能源政策有了更大的影响力，韩国因此缩减了核电计划。【原文：South Korea has scaled down its plans for nuclear power after the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol, an atomic energy advocate, gave the opposition party greater influence over the country’s long-term energy policy.】

item.title: 新西兰将允许通过碳捕集与封存减少排放
item.description: 新西兰将通过允许企业抵消其他温室气体排放来激励企业在地下捕集和储存二氧化碳，从而帮助该国在 2050 年前实现净零排放。【原文：New Zealand will incentivize companies to capture and store carbon dioxide underground by allowing them to offset other greenhouse gas emissions, helping the nation’s push toward becoming a net-zero economy by 2050.】

item.title: Equis 为韩国风电场项目寻求超过 10 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，清洁能源开发商 Equis Development Pte.【原文：Clean energy developer Equis Development Pte. is in talks with banks for a potential loan to fund an offshore South Korean wind farm project, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 拜登的能源部长格兰霍姆加入美国大型公用事业公司董事会
item.description: 詹妮弗-格兰霍姆（Jennifer Granholm）曾担任前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的能源部长，现已被选入美国最大的电力控股公司之一爱迪生国际公司（Edison International）的董事会。【原文：Jennifer Granholm, who served as former President Joe Biden’s energy secretary, has been tapped to the board of Edison International, one of the US’s largest electric utility holding companies.】

item.title: 敦促英国放宽规划规则，让电网为 2030 年做好准备
item.description: 一位政府顾问表示，英国需要放宽规划规则，以确保其瘫痪的电网能够应对更高的需求和可再生能源电力的大规模建设。【原文：The UK needs to relax planning rules to ensure its choked electricity grid can cope with higher demand and a massive build-out of renewable power, a government adviser said.】

item.title: 科学家称欧盟碳市场应包括碳捕集与封存等清除措施
item.description: 欧盟有影响力的科学顾问说，一旦有了确保永久性碳清除（如捕集与封存项目）可信度的系统，欧盟就应将其纳入二氧化碳市场。【原文：The European Union should include permanent carbon removals — such as capture and storage projects — in its CO2 market as soon as there’s a system to ensure they’re credible, the bloc’s influential scientific advisers said.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站复兴面临最后障碍
item.description: 经过十多年的闲置，日本最大的核电站已准备好重新启动；但它面临着无限期的等待。【原文：After more than a decade of inactivity, Japan’s biggest nuclear power plant is ready to restart — but it faces an indefinite wait.】

item.title: 前高盛银行家瞄准特朗普时代遗落的房地产交易
item.description: 这位前高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker running billionaire Tom Steyer’s green real estate unit is targeting deals he says have been left behind by investors spooked by the anti-green rhetoric of the Trump administration.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔离任前一周发出风险警告
item.description: 美联储银行业最高负责人迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）恳请监管机构对金融体系面临的风险保持警惕，因为他准备卸任负责监管的副主席一职，同时继续留任理事会成员。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s top bank cop, Michael Barr, implored regulators to stay vigilant about risks to the financial system as he gets ready to step down from his role as vice chair for supervision while remaining on the Board of Governors.】

item.title: 英国国家环境基金（BNEF）称，到 2050 年，巴西的净零排放转型将耗资 6 万亿美元
item.description:
根据新的分析，可再生能源发电能力已经在稳步增长，但是通过让更多的电动汽车上路，中国可以加快减排速度   

。【原文：

Renewable power capacity is already growing at a steady pace, but the country can accelerate its emissions reductions by getting more electric vehicles on the road, according to new analysis.  

】

item.title: 南非领导人敦促二十国集团团结一致应对全球挑战
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨敦促二十国集团搁置分歧，集中精力应对世界最紧迫的挑战。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa urged the Group of 20 nations to set aside their differences and focus on tackling the world’s most pressing challenges.】

item.title: 肆虐美国中部的冬季寒潮打破气温记录
item.description: 在周末温和天气到来之前，美国中部和南部地区至少还将遭受一天的严寒，一些城市的气温将跌至历史最低点。【原文：Intense cold will grip the central and southern US for at least another day, sending temperatures to all-time lows in some cities before milder weather is set to arrive over the weekend.】

item.title: 银行退缩，英国新气候组织崛起
item.description:
当美国金融公司躲避右翼分子对可持续发展的攻击时，过渡金融委员会正在利用城市和其他方面的力量来扩大脱碳规模。【原文：

While US financial firms flee right-wing attacks on sustainability, the Transition Finance Council is tapping the City and others to scale decarbonization.

】

item.title: 印度小麦作物面临收获前温暖天气的威胁
item.description: 印度本月将面临更加温暖的天气和稀少的降雨，这将威胁到该国的小麦作物，并提高了政府削减或取消谷物进口税的可能性。【原文：India is facing more warm weather and sparse rain this month, threatening the nation’s wheat crop and raising the prospect of the government cutting or removing an import duty on the grain.】

item.title: 生物多样性谈判失败后重启，目标筹资 2,000 亿美元
item.description:
"每个人都认识到生物多样性的急剧减少，"记者娜塔莎-怀特在本周的《零点》节目中说道。"它影响着世界上的每一个国家。【原文：

“Everybody recognizes this drastic loss in biodiversity,” reporter Natasha White says this week on Zero. “It's affecting every country in the world.”

】

item.title: 力拓首席执行官表示，气候目标仍有商业价值
item.description: 世界第二大矿业公司、污染大户力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）站出来支持企业遏制排放的努力，坚持认为追求绿色目标可以增加价值。【原文：Rio Tinto Group, the world’s second-largest mining company and a major polluter, came out in support of corporate efforts to curb emissions, insisting that pursuing green targets can add value.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行、桑坦德银行和巴克莱银行在二氧化碳排放融资方面名列前茅
item.description: 彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）的分析师称，法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）、桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）和巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）是目前和预测融资二氧化碳排放量最高的银行。【原文：BNP Paribas SA, Banco Santander SA and Barclays Plc stand out as the best among banks in terms of their current and forecast financed CO2 emissions, according to analysts at Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 随着特朗普清洗范围扩大，联邦紧急事务管理局瞄准气候和多元化工作人员
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士和彭博新闻社看到的一封联邦紧急事务管理局的内部邮件称，在本周早些时候数百名试用期员工被解雇后，联邦紧急事务管理局与气候变化和相关危害有关的员工的工作岗位将成为下一个砧板。【原文：The jobs of Federal Emergency Management Agency employees tied to climate change and related hazards are next on the chopping block after hundreds of probationary workers were fired earlier this week, according to people familiar with the matter and an internal FEMA email seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 数百个美国石油和黄金项目将接受特朗普的快速审查
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统发布行政命令后，美国陆军工程兵团确定对数百个能源和采矿项目进行紧急快速审查，其中包括密歇根州一条有争议的隧道，用于安桥公司（Enbridge Inc.【原文：A disputed tunnel in Michigan for an Enbridge Inc. oil pipeline is among hundreds of energy and mining projects the US Army Corps of Engineers has identified for emergency fast-track reviews after President Donald Trump’s executive order.】

item.title: CDPQ 和 Systra 赢得加拿大高速铁路项目竞标
item.description: 加拿大将多伦多和魁北克市之间长达 1,000 公里（621 英里）的高速客运铁路项目合同授予由魁北克储蓄与安置银行牵头的一个集团。【原文：Canada awarded a contract for a 1,000-kilometer (621-mile) high-speed passenger rail project between Toronto and Quebec City to a group led by the Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec.】
